data.title: Add Markdown Preview to Editor Scroll Syncronization
data.body:
Part of #5047

Adds an initial implementation of scroll synrconization from the markdown preview to the editor. When the preview is scrolled, automatically scrolls the editor to reveal the same location.

![jan-22-2017 00-48-51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22181243/91f2077e-e03c-11e6-99f0-90c50278e75a.gif)

This required adding a new supported reveal type `AtTop` in our API. This is already supported and used internally, but not really exposed in the public apis (except for the `revealLine` command). 

The scrolling of the editor is still a little choppy. I tried revealing specific character offsets in the string, to smooth out scrolling over long lines, but it doesn't appear to be working as I expected. I'll look into this more. #18811 details some other ways this could work for truly smooth scrolling.

data.title: Terminal close but keep panel open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is a feature request.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5635709/22181236/e60d01b0-e087-11e6-9b9c-be15e4a2e2e9.png)

Most of times i run a server that keeps the terminal open/blocked for new input, and then i want to restart that session.
As of now I need to "Terminate the terminal" and this will close the panel too **because it is the only one.**

What i would appreciate is a configuration to keep the panel open and in fact to reset that very terminal session without the need to reopen the panel/terminal again.

data.title: how select multi file from explorer
data.body: shift not worked. have other way?

data.title: Code should be able to fold on braces instead of indents.
data.body:
I get that you're imitating the awesomeness of Sublime Text, but it was written for Python...

In VS Code, most languages are are braces languages like C/C#, Javascript, PowerShell, Php ...

For VB and Python, you can fold on indents, but for braces languages, you need to enable folding based on pairs of characters, and make that work so that braces fold in pairs without regard for indenting, and ends up looking like:

```
{...}
```
instead of 
```
{...
}
```

data.title: fix #18962. Honor enter rules
data.body: Indentation should not affect enter rules.

data.title: [feature request] yarn tasks & launch support
Shutdown terminal pty process more gracefully
data.body: Particularly on Windows, `pty.kill()` should be called to terminate the process. This will ensure the sockets are closed and the pty agent is shutdown.

data.title: ITerminalInstance.onData and onExit should return a IDisposable so that the listeners can be unregistered.
Allow pinch to zoom when displaying an image
data.body: It would be great if you could support pinch to zoom when opening an image.

data.title: Please expose TerminalInstance.onClose on ITerminalInstance
data.body: I am experimenting with reusing the terminal and to make this work when the user actually closes the terminal (presses the garbage bin button) I need to capture this and remove the terminal from my list of reusable terminals.

data.title: Running bash in the integrated terminal fails to delete characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the integrated terminal.
2. Type `bash` (I use the Git for Windows terminal here)
3. Write something and try to delete it.
4. Instead of deleting the previous characters it seems to write empty spaces.

A similar erratic behavior is also present into the latest stable version but it's not that bad. In the stable version, if you delete some characters, it can happen that some of them are really deleted although still visible.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Interactive Walkthrough CSS
data.body:
Testing #18091 

This needs updating to match the standard one...

**Copy Release Notes Format**  we should match the CSS of the release notes, there are a number of differences i.e.

- [ ] The font used for headings and content is thicker also slightly different spacing
- [ ] Pre-formatted elements are not highlighted e.g `hello` should be a monospace font in yellow by default.
- [ ] Keyboard shortcuts also should be formatted yellow.
- [ ] Blocks (used for Tips) have a different font and color i.e. blue bar not grey

data.title: Menu bar text too large?
data.body:
I opened VSCode today and found that the menu bar text was much larger than usual. 

![screenshot 2017-01-21 10 52 22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7883508/22176108/539f5f90-dfc8-11e6-9c42-6d460bc9aff7.png)

Comparison shot:
![screenshot 2017-01-21 11 17 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7883508/22176243/7dff7056-dfcb-11e6-81f7-eca9981bd2b4.png)

VSCode Version 1.8.1
Windows 10, Version 1607, Build 14393.693

Changing the DPI compatibility setting for code.exe did not fix this. Neither did running with all extensions disabled. Ctrl-+ and Ctrl-- zoom every other aspect of the UI including the sidebar, but not the top menu bar. 

I'd guess this has to do with Electron, seeing as how Chrome had a similar size increase in its UI a little while back. I fixed that with the command flags "/high-dpi-support=1 /force-device-scale-factor=1", but obviously those flags don't work here.

It's such a little thing, but it's driving me nuts. 

Edit: Uninstalling and reinstalling did not fix the problem. Building from source, however, did. 
![screenshot 2017-01-21 14 11 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7883508/22177465/b68ffedc-dfe3-11e6-9643-7757aca12e9e.png)

data.title: Allow the ability to "preview" large files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Mac OSX Sierra

I often have to deal with large text files and currently if I want to just take a peek at one I have to drop to powershell and remember how `Get-Content` works so I can pull off the top 100 lines of the file then open it in VS Code. I have this problem in most editors due to the size of the files. Say 500MB+ CSV dumps.

I would love if VS Code could look at the file size and suggest a "peek" of the Top 100/500 lines etc.

data.title: Fixes #17701 - Integrated Terminal Context Menu is triggered via contextmenu event instead of mousedown
data.body:
Before this change, the Context Menu used to show up on mousedown event in the integrated terminal, but on mouseup (contextmenu event) inside the editor. This change is clearly visible on Windows rather than OS X or Linux when you hold the right-click button.

Now the behavior of the context menu of integrated terminal should be consistent with that of the editor

data.title: In JS files, the function call buffer() is not colored
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

In JavaScript files, the function call `buffer()` is not colored like other function calls, despite not being a reserved word or anything special. It appears to affect all themes.

Screenshot:
http://cl.ly/372Q2G310U1C

Same code as in screenshot (how it should look):
```js
foo()
buffer()
buffer(true)
buffer(foo(true))
```

data.title: [json] Quick Suggestions support for locally installed NPM Modules

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Back then, code has an ability to provide quick suggestions/Intellisense for NPM modules, but this proves to have a strain on the NPM registry so the VS Code team has disabled it.

I am suggesting that we should have Quick Suggestions/Intellisense for **Locally-Installed** Modules instead of querying through the NPM Registry. 

This feature is evident of some popular IDEs like JetBrains Webstorm which proves to increase efficiency and reduces the need to always have documentation opened for a specific module.

data.title: Feature request: add API to add custom icons and functionality behind it to left bar.
data.body:
Currently on **left side bar** VSCode have **only 5 icons** (explorer, search, git, debug, extensions).
**Below** this icons there is really huge **empty area**.

It would we great if we will have some **API to add custom icons** to this area and assign some command to it (as I know there is _such possibility but only for bottom bar_).

 Some action require couple step to perform it (run some command):
 - _open command palette_
 - _search some command and perform it_
 - _if in current command there is subcommands we need to perform couple command selection..._

We can avoid this buy adding special icon with assigned action to left bar - **only on click** to perform some **command** (it will save us a lot of time during development).


For example on _Atom_ there is extension _"tool-bar"_ https://atom.io/packages/tool-bar that implement such functionality:

![1485005635732](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14540860/22174786/169c74d0-dfef-11e6-91f9-0e9d09fa22eb.png)
  

**Huge empty area:**

![1485005292896](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14540860/22174824/44fa5f62-dff0-11e6-99ff-cd9c2c197707.png)

data.title: Cursor Position is wrong after resizing text in editor and jumping to end of line
data.body:
Cursor Position is wrong after resizing text in editor and jumping to end of line.
It's weird, but only happens in "require" lines in JS.

- VSCode Version: **Insiders 
Commit ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6
Date 2017-01-20T14:58:38.006Z**
- OS Version: **Ubuntu 16.04**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set your editor font size to 14 (for instance) in user settings
2. Go to some code that has a "require" statement in a JS file
3. Jump to the end of the line and see it's fine (cursor goes to end)
4. Press CTRL+- (set text one unit smaller) and press END (jump to end of line)
5. Cursor will jump to end of bracket, not end of line

![ezgif com-e0135b3d07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19211868/22174573/8bfe1b0c-dfea-11e6-8e0b-38c76b5df3bf.gif)

data.title: Add sticky header for programming langs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
From emacs' sticky func mode:

> [Displays a header line that shows the declaration line of the function or tag on the topmost line in the text area. This allows you to keep that declaration line in view at all times, even if it is scrolls off the “top” of the screen.](https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/semantic/Sticky-Func-Mode.html)

I rely on this mode heavily. Jetbrains' IDEs like Pycharm and IntelliJ also have similar functionalities. I hope you can add this to vscode:D

data.title: Improve multicursor experience
data.body:
The following actions: | Label | Default Keybinding | |---|---| | Add Selection To Next Find Match | Ctrl+D
Cmd+D (Mac) | | Move Last Selection To Next Find Match | Ctrl+K,Ctrl+D
Cmd+K,Cmd+D (Mac) | | Add Selection To Previous Find Match | - | | Move Last Selection To Previous Find Match | - | | Select All Occurrences of Find Match | Ctrl+Shift+L
Cmd+Shift+L (Mac) | | Change All Occurrences | Ctrl+F2
Cmd+F2 (Mac) | **change their behaviour based on the find input state even if the find widget is hidden**: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22174179/50a696ae-dfd8-11e6-8a54-4042ad1b1e05.png) There are numerous issues where folks are confused by this and do not realize that the `Match Case` and `Match Whole Words` toggles influence these actions. Moreover, the two toggles can be changed via keybindings **even when the find widget is hidden**: | Option | Default keybinding | |---|---| | `Match Case` | Alt+C
Cmd+Alt+C (Mac) | | `Match Whole Word` | Alt+W
Cmd+Alt+W (Mac) |

data.title: Support undo and redo in input fields (fixes #151)
data.body:
Follows the same strategy as we had for the "Select All" command by using `document.execCommand` in case an input field or textarea currently has focus. This enables `undo` and `redo` via keyboard on macOS if focus is inside these.

This also enables `Edit > Undo` and `Edit > Redo` to work properly on all OS.

One behavioural change is that invoking Undo/Redo when the editor does NOT have focus will now execute these commands in the editor even though it does not have focus. This is the same with the Select All command. We could control this behaviour and say that Undo/Redo only work if the editor has focus. I leave that up to you.

data.title: New titlebar doesn't work with hyperdock on mac

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I know this is an extreme case but I would be happy if this was fixed. I use [hyperdock](https://bahoom.com/hyperdock/) to bring the snapping window functionality that windows has to mac. Only vscode doesn't respect the snapping feature. I am not exactly sure after which update this issue started, but as far as I know it started after the titlebar got its custom look.

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download [hyperdock](https://bahoom.com/hyperdock/) . It is free to try, you can download to reproduce the bug
2. Snap other windows like your web browser etc to make sure it's working
3. Try snapping vscode to a side. It won't work

data.title: Extension tab is closed and marketplace search lost upon reload
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. search for extension, install it
2. you are forced to reload the window to see if the extension does what you want
3. upon reload the tab with extension details is not restored and marketplace panel lost the serach query, so you are forced to start your search from the beginning

In other words, finding a working extension for a given task (e.g. formatting an XML file) can be very frustrating since many extensions don't work at all or don't do what they say they do.

data.title: auto-formatting seems to be broken with svg style attribute
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

Create a plain html file with this contents, I've stripped this down from a full HTML page to this

 - This HTML seems to produce incorrect indentation on the `<g>` tag, caused by the style attribute
```
<svg>
    <g>
        <rect style="width:200px;"></rect>
</g>
</svg>
```

- this HTML seems to indent fine (I've removed the style on the rect tag)

```
<svg>
    <g>
        <rect></rect>
    </g>
</svg>
```

data.title: missing dependency on 'libxss1' for Debian/Ubuntu package
data.body:
Hi

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1-1482158209
- OS Version: Debian 7.11 (x86_64)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS Code
```
doru@r2:~$ code
/usr/share/code/bin/../code: error while loading shared libraries: libXss.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

Steps to Fix:

1. Install missing package
`root@r2:~# apt-get install libxss1`

Thanks
